overview: Bernhard Ronacher is a molecular biologist, geneticist and biochemist. Ronacher has developed the basic idea of the hybcell. During the years 2000 to 2002 he headed the molecular diagnostics laboratory of Lambda GmbH. There he established the DNA chip&array technology. 2001 the first Austrian biochip, ParoCheck, was filed for patent. In 2002 Lambda was successfully sold to Greiner Bio-One. During his work at the university he managed for the very first time to unscramble the course of infection by Rhino viruses, mainly responsible for the common cold. His work is fundamental for the development of anti-viral agents and was awarded from the European Hoechst Foundation.
